commitmentSection.title: Professionalism. Transparency. Warmth. Protection.
commitmentSection.description: This is our lasting commitment to every journey we help build.

costSection.title1: From Budget Planning to Baby's Arrival
costSection.description1: Every surrogacy journey is unique. Costs may vary based on factors like embryo status, clinic selection, and insurance needs. Typical expenses include agency fees, legal services, surrogate compensation, medical care, and insurance.
costSection.description2: At Yunda, most intended parents can expect to spend $150,000 to $200,000 USD, which includes:
costSection.item1: $55,000–$70,000+ USD in surrogate compensation and pregnancy support
costSection.item2: Legal, medical, and insurance-related third-party costs
costSection.item3: All payments are securely managed through a milestone-based escrow account
costSection.description4: We provide every client with a clear cost breakdown and personalized financial planning, so you can move forward with confidence and focus on welcoming your baby.

globalSupportSection.title: Global Support For Every Family
globalSupportSection.description: Yunda Surrogacy is a professional agency specializing in cross-border assisted reproduction, offering services across all legally supported surrogacy states in the U.S. We partner with world-class fertility clinics, mental health professionals, and insurance providers to deliver fully customized, end-to-end support for intended parents from all backgrounds- including older couples, LGBTQ+ individuals, and single parents.

heroSection.title: Professionalism. Transparency. Warmth. Protection.
heroSection.description: Our unwavering promise to every family and every surrogate.

journeySection.description: At Yunda, we believe every path to parenthood deserves care, attention, and respect. With professional guidance and constant support, we walk alongside you—from the first conversation to the moment you meet your baby.

step1.title: Consultation & Planning
step1.description: We begin with a one-on-one conversation to understand your background, preferences, and timeline. Based on your needs, we design a personalized plan and recommend suitable IVF clinics and physicians.

step2.title: Surrogate Matching & Medical Screening
step2.description: We share surrogate profiles tailored to your preferences and arrange video interviews. Once matched, we coordinate all necessary medical evaluations to ensure the surrogate is approved for embryo transfer.

step3.title: Legal Process & Embryo Transfer
step3.description: Our in-house legal team prepares and reviews all contracts and manages the pre-birth order process. Meanwhile, the surrogate begins her medication cycle and completes the embryo transfer under clinical supervision.

step4.title: Pregnancy Support & Baby's Arrival
step4.description: Throughout the pregnancy, the surrogate receives both emotional and medical care. Your dedicated case manager provides weekly updates and helps coordinate any issues, leading up to the safe birth and handover of your baby.

legalExpertiseSection.title: Our Legal Expertise
legalExpertiseSection.description1: Our most defining strength is our legal team, recognized for its depth and expertise in reproductive law. From early-stage risk evaluation to contract negotiation, parentage establishment, and birth certification, our legal experts are involved at every step—ensuring each journey is secure, ethical, and fully compliant. We do not rely on external firms—we build legal protection from within.

statsSection.stat1: Years of experience in third-party reproduction
statsSection.stat3: Full IVF and surrogacy journeys completed
statsSection.stat4: Client satisfaction rate sustained over the years

agencyFees.title: Surrogacy Agency Fees
agencyFees.description2: Surrogate recruitment, screening, and profile preparation
agencyFees.description3: One-on-one case manager for personalized guidance

screeningAdmin.title: Screening & Admin
screeningAdmin.description2: Coordination with IVF clinic and records submission

insuranceSupport.title: Insurance Support
insuranceSupport.description1: Pregnancy insurance planning or cash-pay options

additionalTerms.title: Additional Terms for Yunda Surrogacy Package
additionalTerms.description: At Yunda, we are committed to offering transparent and predictable cost management for every intended parent. The following outlines potential additional expenses that may arise during the surrogacy process. These terms will also be incorporated into the formal legal agreement. Please note that all figures are estimates — you will be responsible only for actual costs incurred by the surrogate, and any unused funds will be refunded after final reconciliation at the end of the journey. All estimates assume delivery occurs at a standard hospital near the surrogate’s place of residence. If you request a specific location or if medical needs change, costs may vary accordingly.

surrogateBenefits.title: Surrogate Benefits May Include:
surrogateBenefits.childcare: Childcare allowance: per child per day (with receipts)
surrogateBenefits.lostWages: Lost wages: Based on the surrogate’s documented employment
surrogateBenefits.uterineLoss: Uterine loss compensation: Partial removal / Full hysterectomy

notIncluded.title: Not Included in the Package:
notIncluded.ivfCosts: IVF clinic and fertility doctor costs (selected by the client)
notIncluded.newbornExpenses: Newborn-related medical expenses after birth (e.g., NICU care, vaccines)
notIncluded.clientTravel: Client’s travel, accommodation, and personal expenses during the journey

insuranceNotes.title: Surrogate Insurance Notes:
insuranceNotes.description1: If the surrogate qualifies during open enrollment, we will present a selection of compliant medical plans for your review and purchase
insuranceNotes.description2: If insurance is not available, we will help arrange cash-pay options with the OB and hospital; common estimates include ~$5,000 for OB care and ~$8,000 for hospital delivery
insuranceNotes.description3: If the surrogate has employer-provided insurance, we will still arrange for a secondary policy to ensure full pregnancy coverage
insuranceNotes.description4: Note: Neither primary nor secondary insurance can guarantee 100% coverage — you are responsible for any deductibles, co-pays, or out-of-pocket expenses not reimbursed by insurance

confidenceSection.title: Ready to Plan Your Journey?
confidenceSection.description: Let’s start with a personalized consultation—no pressure, just answers.

heroSection.title: How Much Does Surrogacy Cost?
heroSection.description: Surrogacy is a journey of love—and a financial decision that deserves clarity.  At Yunda, we believe in full transparency, detailed breakdowns, and no hidden fees.

step1.title: Agency Coordination
step1.subtitle: Bilingual support, surrogate matching, full journey coordination

step2.title: Medical Screening & Admin
step2.subtitle: Background checks, clinic liaison, document handling

step3.title: Surrogate Compensation
step3.subtitle: Base pay + monthly allowance + travel & maternity reimbursements

step5.title: Insurance Planning
step5.subtitle: Pregnancy coverage, newborn medical insurance support

step6.title: Optional Costs
step6.subtitle: Twins, C-section, childcare, breast milk pumping & more

confidenceSection.title: A Journey with Confidence and Care
confidenceSection.description1: Surrogacy is not just a medical process — it’s a path toward building the family you’ve been dreaming of. From your first consultation to holding your baby in your arms, Yunda Surrogacy is here to guide and support you every step of the way.
confidenceSection.description2: We understand that this journey can feel overwhelming at times. That’s why intended parents choose Yunda — for our experience, transparency, and heartfelt commitment to making every detail feel clear, smooth, and supported.

step1.title: Getting Started

tasks.task1: Fill out Intended Parent Matching Form

step1.description: Once you begin with Yunda, you’ll meet your dedicated case manager who will guide you through your personalized surrogacy plan. Whether you already have embryos or are just starting out, we’ll help clarify your goals and timeline. You’ll sign a service agreement to officially begin your journey with Yunda.

step2.title: Medical Preparation

tasks.task1: IVF clinic coordination or connect with your chosen provider
tasks.task2: Medical testing and U.S. travel planning

step2.description: This stage focuses on preparing medically for the surrogacy process. Whether you're creating embryos or working with existing ones, Yunda helps with clinic coordination, medical documentation, and all logistical details—ensuring a smooth start to your cycle.

step3.title: Surrogate Matching & Screening

tasks.task1: Receive surrogate profiles with background and health info
tasks.task2: Intro video calls with candidates (if desired)
tasks.task3: Lock in match and begin medical clearance
tasks.task4: Medical records submitted and full screening scheduled

step3.description: You’ll be introduced to pre-screened, qualified surrogates based on your preferences. Once a match is confirmed, we’ll proceed with detailed medical clearance and ensure the surrogate is fully approved to move forward.

step4.title: Legal & Trust Setup

tasks.task2: Contract review and signing for both parties
tasks.task4: Sign contracts securely, even from abroad

step4.description: We assist with setting up a third-party trust account to manage reimbursements and fees transparently. Your legal team will handle all necessary agreements to ensure your parental rights and expectations are protected.

step5.title: Transfer & Confirmation
step5.description: The embryo transfer marks an exciting milestone. After confirmation through pregnancy tests and ultrasound, you’ll be one step closer to parenthood.

step6.title: Pregnancy Support & Delivery

tasks.task1: Ongoing OB care and regular updates
tasks.task2: Weekly check-ins from your Yunda case manager
tasks.task5: Support with travel permits, passport, and return home

step6.description: From the first trimester to delivery, Yunda provides comprehensive care and guidance. We support you and your surrogate throughout the pregnancy and ensure all legal and travel documents are ready for a smooth homecoming with your baby.

processHeroSection.title: A Gentle Start to an Extraordinary Journey
processHeroSection.subtitle: Welcoming a baby through surrogacy is a path full of love and intention.
processHeroSection.description: At Yunda Surrogacy, we're here not just as a service provider, but as caring partners beside you every step of the way. Every family begins this journey differently. Some are just beginning to explore, while others have embryos ready. No matter where you are, we'll walk with you—at your pace, with clarity and heart. The full journey usually takes 12 to 16 months, and we'll make every step feel supported.

heroSection.title: Why Your IVF Clinic Matters
heroSection.description: Your surrogacy journey often begins with embryo creation. The right clinic not only impacts embryo quality—it shapes your entire experience. Yunda partners with top U.S. and Asian fertility centers to ensure success from day one.

recommendClinics.title: Recommend Trusted Clinics
recommendClinics.description: We suggest high-success-rate clinics and doctors based on your goals.

coordinateConsultations.title: Coordinate Consultations
coordinateConsultations.description: Book in-person or virtual IVF appointments for you.

handleShipping.title: Handle Embryo Shipping
handleShipping.description: Manage legal & FDA-compliant international embryo transport.

prepareDocuments.title: Prepare Medical Documents
prepareDocuments.description: Help you complete screening paperwork abroad.

workWithChosen.title: Work With Your Chosen Clinic
workWithChosen.description: Already have a clinic? We coordinate directly with them too.

eggDonation.title: Egg Donation & Retrieval
eggDonation.description: We match you with an egg donor and coordinate retrieval for IVF.

embryoCreation.title: Embryo Creation & Freezing
embryoCreation.description: Embryos are fertilized, cultured, and frozen for future transfer.

embryoShipping.title: Embryo Shipping (International)
embryoShipping.description: Legal transport from Hong Kong, Japan, and other countries to U.S. clinics.

embryoTransfer.title: Embryo Transfer
embryoTransfer.description: Carried out at the IVF clinic once your surrogate is ready.

geneticTesting.title: PGT-A Genetic Testing
geneticTesting.description: Optional chromosome screening to increase implantation success.

embryoThawing.title: Embryo Thawing & Surrogate Preparation
embryoThawing.description: Thawed embryos + monitored hormone treatment to optimize transfer timing.

clinicsSection.title: Some of Our Trusted IVF Clinic Partners

chooseClinic.question: Can I choose my own IVF clinic?
chooseClinic.answer: Yes. You're welcome to work with any FDA-compliant clinic. We're happy to assist with coordination.

embryoShipping.question: Can embryos be shipped from abroad to the U.S.? What documents are required?
embryoShipping.answer: Yes. We assist with all legal, medical, and logistical documents required for safe transfer.

frozenEmbryos.question: Can frozen embryos be used for surrogacy?
frozenEmbryos.answer: Absolutely. Frozen embryos are safe, effective, and commonly used.

eggDonationCreation.question: I don't have embryos yet. Can I do egg donation and embryo creation together?
eggDonationCreation.answer: Yes. We can coordinate both processes with our clinic partners to save time.

medicalCosts.question: Are medical costs included in the surrogacy package?
medicalCosts.answer: Partially. Medical expenses from IVF clinics are billed separately, but we help you select and communicate with the best clinics.

confidenceSection.title: Need Help Choosing a Clinic?
confidenceSection.description: Whether you're starting from scratch or already have embryos, Yunda will match you with the right clinic and guide you through every medical step.

heroSection.title: Love Creates Families
heroSection.description: At Yunda, we proudly welcome LGBTQ+ individuals, single parents, and non-traditional families with open arms, professional support, and unwavering respect.

testimonialSection.title: "We're Dads Now"
testimonialSection.quote: "Going through surrogacy for the second time, we chose Yunda for a smoother, more transparent journey — and they exceeded all expectations. Our coordinator was incredibly thoughtful and responsive. Most importantly, we felt safe and respected every step of the way as a same-sex couple. The structured costs helped reduce stress, and now we're home… as new dads."

offerSection.title: What We Offer LGBTQ+ & Single Parents

inclusive.title: Inclusive & Judgment-Free Process
inclusive.description: Respectful, unbiased support at every stage—legal, medical, and emotional.

matching.title: LGBTQ+ Friendly Matching
matching.description: Surrogates and clinics that embrace and support same-sex and single-parent families.

legal.title: Legal Expertise
legal.description: PBO planning and birth certificate setup tailored for LGBTQ+ and single parents.

global.title: Global Experience
global.description: Specialized in serving families from Asia, the U.S., and worldwide.

multilingual.title: Multilingual Support
multilingual.description: Seamless communication in both English and Chinese.

personalized.title: Personalized Guidance
personalized.description: 1-on-1 support for your unique family structure, no matter where you live.

sameSexLegal.question: Can same-sex couples legally be recognized as parents in the U.S.?
sameSexLegal.answer: Yes. Many states allow Pre-Birth Orders (PBOs) so you can be listed as legal parents. Yunda handles legal planning for you.

singleParent.question: Can I pursue surrogacy as a single parent?
singleParent.answer: Absolutely. We'll tailor your surrogacy plan to meet your needs as a single parent.

coupleInChina.question: We're a same-sex couple living in China – can we do surrogacy in the U.S.?
coupleInChina.answer: Yes. Everything from contracts to surrogate matching can be done remotely. We'll guide you through it all.

bringBabyBack.question: Can we bring our baby back to China after birth?
bringBabyBack.answer: Yes. We assist with U.S. passport, Chinese Travel Permit, SSN, and Hague Apostille to ensure smooth re-entry.

bothNames.question: Can both of our names appear on the birth certificate?
bothNames.answer: Yes. With a PBO in an LGBTQ+-friendly state, both names can legally be listed.

confidenceSection.title: Ready to Start Your Journey?
confidenceSection.description: Let us help you build the family you've dreamed of—with care, clarity, and respect for who you are.

heroSection.title: Find Your Egg Donor
heroSection.description1: Egg donation is a meaningful path for intended parents who are unable to conceive with their own eggs—due to medical conditions, age, or being a single or same-sex male parent.
heroSection.description2: At Yunda, we provide a compassionate and professional egg donation program with fully screened donors across the U.S. You can choose donors based on ethnicity, education, and appearance, with guidance every step of the way.

frozenEggsSection.title: Should I Use Frozen Eggs Instead of Fresh Eggs?
frozenEggsSection.description: Yes, both options are available. Frozen eggs are a great fit for those who want to start quickly or prefer not to sync with a donor's cycle. We partner with trusted egg banks offering diverse donor profiles, including donors of Asian descent with strong academic backgrounds.

freshEggsDetails.donorAccess: Choose donor; video call/open donation possible

usProcessSection.title: Do I Need to Be in the U.S. for This Process?
usProcessSection.providingSpermDesc: You can collect samples in Hong Kong, Japan, or elsewhere—Yunda will handle certified medical shipping
usProcessSection.providingEggsDesc: You will typically need to travel to the U.S. for the retrieval cycle (approx. 10–14 days), unless using frozen eggs from our donor bank
usProcessSection.conclusion: Yunda handles all cross-border logistics, clinic coordination, and legal compliance.

stepsTimeline.title: Our Streamlined Egg Donation + IVF Process

step1.title: Consultation & Donor Selection
step1.subtitle1: Intro call with a Yunda coordinator
step1.subtitle4: Sign engagement letter and make payment to confirm

step2.title: Medical & Psychological Screening
step2.subtitle2: Complete genetic, infectious disease, and ultrasound screenings
step2.subtitle5: IVF insurance arranged for donor before medication begins

step3.title: Stimulation Cycle & Embryo Creation
step3.subtitle1: Donor travels with full support from Yunda
step3.subtitle4: Fertilization and embryo culture in IVF lab
step3.subtitle5: PGT-A testing conducted on Day 5/6 embryos
step3.subtitle6: Share genetic testing results within 2–3 weeks

confidenceSection.title: Ready to Explore Your Egg Donation Journey?
confidenceSection.description: Let’s start with a personalized consultation—no pressure, just answers.

heroSection.title: Surrogacy Journey Overview
heroSection.description: From the moment you apply to become a surrogate to the postpartum recovery after delivery, this journey is not only about helping others build their families—it's also a deeply meaningful experience of compassion, growth, and connection. At Yunda Surrogacy, we recognize the importance of your role and are committed to guiding and supporting you at every step. While every journey is unique, the average surrogacy process typically takes 16 to 18 months.

step1.title: Submit Application
step1.subtitle: Begin your journey by filling out our online application. Surrogacy is not only about receiving compensation—it's about helping someone become a parent.

step2.title: Psychological Evaluation
step2.subtitle: A licensed therapist will assess your emotional readiness to become a surrogate. This ensures you are mentally and emotionally prepared for the journey ahead.

step3.title: Background Check
step3.subtitle: For everyone's safety, we'll run a full background check. This includes legal, child welfare, and in-home history to ensure a stable environment.

step4.title: Matching with Intended Parents
step4.subtitle: Based on shared preferences and expectations, we'll match you with intended parents. You'll meet them in a casual video call, supported by our case manager.

step5.title: Medical Screening
step5.subtitle: You'll visit a fertility clinic for physical screening. All costs are covered. If you have a partner, he may also undergo simple blood tests.

step6.title: Legal Agreements
step6.subtitle: After medical clearance, both sides will work with independent attorneys to draft and sign the surrogacy contract. Your rights and choices are fully respected.

step7.title: Embryo Transfer & Pregnancy
step7.subtitle: With contracts signed, you'll start medications for embryo transfer. After transfer, you'll attend regular doctor visits and receive ongoing care and compensation.

step8.title: Birth & Beyond
step8.subtitle: The birth is a special moment for everyone. After delivery, you'll return home with support and rest. Many surrogates choose to stay in touch with the families they've helped.

testimonial1.name: Emily, 32 years old, California
testimonial1.quote: Becoming a surrogate was the most empowering thing I've ever done. Yunda supported me every step, and seeing the parents hold their baby for the first time—I'll never forget that moment.

testimonial2.name: Jessica, 29 years old, Texas
testimonial2.quote: I had a great experience working with Yunda. The communication was honest and clear, and they truly cared about my well-being—not just physically, but emotionally too.

testimonial3.name: Carmen, 30 years old, Oregon
testimonial3.quote: I was nervous at first, but Yunda answered all my questions patiently. The weekly updates, the check-ins, and their care made me feel like I was part of something truly meaningful.

testimonial4.name: Amber, 35 years old, Nevada
testimonial4.quote: As a mom myself, I know how much love a child brings. Helping another family feel that love was something I'll cherish forever. Yunda made sure I felt respected and appreciated throughout.

confidenceSection.title: Think You Might Be a Good Fit?
confidenceSection.description: Talk with a Yunda advisor one-on-one to learn more about eligibility and compensation.

heroSection.title: Eligibility to Become a Surrogate
heroSection.description: At Yunda Surrogacy, we believe that women who are willing to help others grow a family deserve the highest respect, support, and care. Becoming a surrogate is a meaningful commitment—and we're here to walk with you every step of the way.

qualificationsSection.title: Basic Qualifications
qualificationsSection.introduction: To ensure a healthy and secure journey for everyone, we ask that all surrogates meet the following minimum qualifications:

items.item2: Have had at least one full-term, uncomplicated vaginal birth
items.item3: Currently live in a stable home with reliable support
items.item4: Be a U.S. citizen or permanent resident (Green Card holder)
items.item5: Live a healthy lifestyle, including being a non-smoker
items.item6: Have no criminal background or child abuse history

qualificationsSection.additionalNote: We welcome women of all backgrounds—single, married, working moms or stay-at-home—if you are physically and emotionally ready to give this incredible gift, we'd love to hear from you.

disqualifyingFactors.title: Common Disqualifying Factors
disqualifyingFactors.introduction: You may not qualify for surrogacy if you:

items.item2: Had serious complications in previous pregnancies
items.item3: Have a BMI above the acceptable limit (usually 33)
items.item4: Are currently on antidepressants or have ongoing mental health issues
items.item5: Do not have financial stability or family support
items.item6: Reside in a state that restricts surrogacy (our team can help verify)

gentleNote.title: A Gentle Note
gentleNote.description: Not qualifying for surrogacy is never a judgment of your character. It simply means that at this time, your body or environment may not align with the medical or legal standards for surrogacy. We're happy to offer other ways to stay involved and support hopeful parents.

confidenceSection.title: Think You Might Be a Good Fit?
confidenceSection.description: Talk with a Yunda advisor one-on-one to learn more about eligibility and compensation.

heroSection.title: Our Screening Process
heroSection.description: At Yunda Surrogacy, we believe that every surrogate deserves to be fully informed, cared for, and protected. That's why we've designed a thorough, respectful, and supportive screening process to ensure you're ready—physically, emotionally, and practically—for the surrogacy journey ahead. Our screening process helps us understand your unique story and ensure that you are a great fit for this life-changing experience. It also gives you a chance to ask questions and feel confident every step of the way.

includesList.item2: Introductory consultation with our care team
includesList.item3: Psychological screening by a licensed therapist

processSection.includesNote: We cover all screening costs and guide you closely through each step. There's no pressure—only support. Once you're medically and psychologically cleared, we'll move on to matching you with the perfect intended parents.
processSection.candidateTitle: What Makes a Strong and Healthy Surrogate Candidate?
processSection.candidateIntro: To protect both surrogates and intended parents, and to ensure a healthy, successful journey, all candidates must meet the following medical, lifestyle, and legal requirements. These standards are based on guidelines from top IVF clinics and the American Society for Reproductive Medicine (ASRM).

candidateList.item5: At Least One Prior Healthy Pregnancy
candidateList.item6: No Major Obstetric or Chronic Medical History

confidenceSection.title: Think You Might Be a Good Fit?
confidenceSection.description: Talk with a Yunda advisor one-on-one to learn more about eligibility and compensation.

heroSection.title: Compensation & Benefits for Surrogates
heroSection.description: At Yunda Surrogacy, we believe surrogacy is a profound and life-changing journey — one that deserves meaningful rewards and deep respect. As a Yunda surrogate, you'll receive a clear, personalized, and compassionate compensation plan tailored just for you. Your package is designed based on your experience, where you live, and whether you have eligible health insurance. We proudly partner with SeedTrust (the nation's leading escrow service) and ART Risk (the premier surrogacy insurance provider) to ensure every payment is made safely, on time, and with your protection and peace of mind at the center

familySupportSection.title: Our Surrogate Screening Includes:
familySupportSection.description: More than payment — it's about support, respect, and being seen. We've designed a Family Support Plan to make sure you and your family are truly cared for every step of the way:

items.item1: Support for housekeeping, childcare, and wage loss if you're placed on doctor-ordered bed rest
items.item2: Partner wage compensation if travel is required
items.item3: Weekly compensation if you choose to provide breast milk post-delivery
items.item4: Dedicated Yunda coordinator for one-on-one support throughout the journey

compensationSection.title: Your Surrogate Compensation Package May Include:

items.item1: Personalized Base Compensation: $50,000 to $70,000+ for first-time surrogates, paid monthly starting from confirmed heartbeat
items.item2: Monthly Allowance: Covers transportation, meals, childcare, and miscellaneous expenses
items.item3: IVF Medication Stipend: One-time payment at medication start
items.item4: Embryo Transfer Compensation: Per transfer procedure
items.item5: Pregnancy & Recovery Support: Clothing, nutrition, and recovery benefits
items.item6: Special Procedure Compensation: $500–$5,000 depending on procedure
items.item7: Multiples Bonus: $10,000+ for twins or triplets, paid in installments
items.item8: C-section Compensation: $5,000 for first, $3,000 for repeat
items.item10: Lost Wages: Up to $10,000 for surrogate and partner if required
items.item13: Life Insurance: $250,000 for surrogate, $100,000 for intended parents

items.item1: VF-related stipends begin after medication or transfer
items.item2: Base compensation starts after heartbeat confirmation
items.item3: Final balance paid within 14 days post-delivery
items.item4: Other benefits paid as needed or on rolling basis

items.item3: Legal representation by top reproductive law attorneys

surrogacyBenefit.conclusionText: Becoming a surrogate means becoming a miracle-maker who changes someone's world. At Yunda, we make sure you're just as cherished in return. We offer more than compensation — we offer heartfelt support, a partnership built on trust, and a journey where you're cared for every step of the way.

confidenceSection.title: Think You Might Be a Good Fit?
confidenceSection.description: Talk with a Yunda advisor one-on-one to learn more about eligibility and compensation.

heroSection.title: Surrogate Referral Program
heroSection.description: Help a Loving Woman Become a Hero — And Earn up to $5,000 Every year, thousands of hopeful parents dream of having a child — and gestational surrogates make those dreams come true. If you know someone with a generous heart and a strong body who may be interested in becoming a surrogate, we invite you to refer her to our program. And as a token of appreciation, you could receive up to $5,000 for each successful referral.

whyMattersSection.title: Why Your Referral Matters
whyMattersSection.description: You're not just helping a friend begin a powerful and meaningful journey—you're helping another family finally hold the baby they've dreamed of. And we'll thank you for it, every step of the way.

earningsSection.title: How Much Can You Earn?

milestones.accepted: Surrogate is officially accepted by Yunda

earningsSection.terms1: Bonuses are paid within 14 business days after each milestone.
earningsSection.terms2: You must be listed as the referral in your friend's initial application.

eligibilitySection.title: Who Makes a Great Surrogate?
eligibilitySection.intro: We're looking for women who are:

requirements.pregnancy: Have had at least one healthy pregnancy
requirements.support: Emotionally supported by family or friends
requirements.health: No serious pregnancy complications or chronic health issues

benefits.bedrest: Wage protection for bed rest (up to $10,000)
benefits.processing: All compensation is processed securely through SeedTrust

confidenceSection.description: Over a hundred incredible women have already partnered with Yunda to help others build their families—and in doing so, they've also experienced personal growth and fulfillment. A referral is a gesture of belief in her—and our thank you is a promise to you.

footer.legalDisclaimer: Yunda Surrogacy is an independent surrogacy agency and does not practice medicine or law. We support clients by facilitating connections and services, but all medical and legal decisions remain the responsibility of licensed professionals.

qualificationQuestions.age: Are you between 21 and 42 years old?
qualificationQuestions.pregnancy: Have you had at least one full-term pregnancy with no major complications?
qualificationQuestions.childcare: Are you currently raising at least one child in a stable home environment?
qualificationQuestions.citizenship: Are you a U.S. citizen, permanent resident, or valid long-term visa holder (valid for 2+ years)?
qualificationQuestions.education: Have you completed high school and received a diploma or GED?

messages.notQualified: Thanks for applying – We hope to cross paths again soon.

congratulations.title: Congratulations – You Qualify!
congratulations.message1: We're thrilled to let you know that based on your answers, you meet the basic requirements to become a surrogate with Yunda Surrogacy. That's a beautiful first step toward helping someone build their family — and we're so honored to walk this journey with you.
congratulations.message2: The next step is to complete a more detailed questionnaire about your background, health history, and preferences. This helps us understand you better and ensures that we can match you with intended parents who are the right fit — emotionally, ethically, and practically.
congratulations.thanks: Thank you for considering this incredible act of generosity.

form.smsConsent: I consent to receive text messages at this number
form.howDidYouHear: How did you hear about Yunda Surrogacy?

previousSurrogate.question: Have you ever been a surrogate before?
previousSurrogate.description: If yes, please briefly describe the time and experience:

partnerSupport.question: Will your spouse/partner support you through this journey?

education.highSchool: Do you have a high school diploma or GED equivalent?

income.question: What is your household's combined annual income?

givenBirth.question: Have you given birth before?
givenBirth.description: If yes, please specify the parity, year of birth, and any complications during delivery:

pregnancy.stillbirth: Have you ever experienced a stillbirth?

medicalHistory.question: Do you have a history of the following?

medications.question: Are you currently taking any prescription medications?

assistance.question: Are you receiving any of the following government assistance programs?

criminalRecord.question: Have you ever been convicted of a crime?

legalMatters.question: Do you or your partner currently have unresolved legal matters (bankruptcy, divorce, lawsuits, etc.)?

legal.cpsHistory: Have you or your partner ever had a case with Child Protective Services (CPS)?

finalConsent.text: I consent to sharing my personal and sensitive information with Yunda Surrogacy, and receiving future communication via text, email, phone, or post according to the Privacy Policy.
finalConsent.disclaimer: Your information will be kept strictly confidential and will not be shared or sold to any third parties.

welcome.title: Welcoming a child into your life starts with a conversation.
welcome.message1: We'd love to learn more about you — your hopes, your questions, and the kind of support you're looking for. By completing this brief application, you'll help us understand how to best support your path to parenthood.
welcome.message2:
Once submitted, our team will follow up with a personalized information package — no pressure, no commitment,
just guidance made for you.
welcome.message3: We proudly support intended parents from around the world.

languages.note: Yunda's primary service language is English, but we have consultants who speak Mandarin and interpreters available to support you throughout your journey — including communication with your surrogate.

meta.title: About Us - Yunda Surrogacy
meta.description: Learn about Yunda Surrogacy - Where Professional Commitment Meets Heartfelt Care. Meet our experienced team dedicated to your surrogacy journey.

hero.title: Where Professional Commitment Meets Heartfelt Care
hero.paragraph1: At Yunda Surrogacy, we are more than a surrogacy agency—we are your dedicated partners on a deeply human journey. Our team brings together expertise in reproductive law, fertility coordination, clinical advocacy, and international case management—with something just as important: personal experience.
hero.paragraph2: Many of us are parents through surrogacy, former surrogates, or lifelong advocates for family-building. We've sat in waiting rooms. We've held hands during embryo transfers. We've felt the anticipation, the anxiety, and the indescribable joy. That's why we don't just work in this field—we live it.
hero.paragraph3: From your first consultation to the moment a baby is placed into loving arms, we ensure every step is handled with professionalism, empathy, and clarity. Whether you're a surrogate offering the gift of life or an intended parent dreaming of a family,
hero.highlight: Yunda walks beside you—with honesty, respect, and unwavering dedication.

bio.paragraph1: Kayla earned her degree from Cornell University and completed her graduate studies at Columbia University. She is fluent in Mandarin, English, and German, and brings over 8 years of experience in the field of assisted reproduction.
bio.paragraph2: Before founding Yunda Surrogacy, she worked as an international fertility consultant, helping clients from diverse cultural backgrounds complete their journeys through surrogacy and egg donation.
bio.paragraph3: Kayla's passion for this work stems from personal experience. As a mother of two children born through surrogacy, she has lived the joy and uncertainty of this process firsthand. Her encounters with unqualified legal advice and a lack of transparency fueled her commitment to creating a more ethical, warm, and professional surrogacy platform.
bio.paragraph4: At Yunda, Kayla is guided by the principles of legal integrity, emotional support, and clinical excellence. Outside of work, she enjoys traveling, reading, and spending time with her children—who remind her daily of the profound impact of this mission.

bio.paragraph1: Zoe holds a degree from California State University, Los Angeles. Before entering the surrogacy industry, she worked for 9 years as a nurse at two of California's top fertility clinics—Huntington Reproductive Center and Santa Monica Fertility Center.
bio.paragraph2: Since 2016, Zoe has fully devoted herself to the fertility field, driven by a passion to help people achieve their dreams of parenthood through IVF, surrogacy, and egg donation.
bio.paragraph3: At Yunda, she supports international clients with tailored guidance throughout their medical journey, ensuring clarity and care every step of the way. She believes everyone deserves honest, transparent, and compassionate support.
bio.paragraph4: Zoe is an advocate for healthy living—she enjoys travel, outdoor adventures, and cooking plant-based meals for her family. She also volunteers with reproductive advocacy groups, bringing her care philosophy beyond the workplace.
bio.paragraph5: Interested in working with Yunda or exploring partnership opportunities? Let's connect.

careers.title: Want to help build families and make a real difference?
careers.description:
We're always looking for compassionate, driven individuals to join our growing team.
You're welcome to explore our open roles on Indeed
— we'd love to meet you
